original: 2.A new Exhibit D-1, as set forth in Schedule 2 to this Amendment, shall be attached to the Agreement and incorporated therein by reference. As of April 1, 2018 and continuing until Cerus determines, in its sole discretion, that the Protocol EPP-029-886 under which Porex is currently operating can be discontinued, the price for Platelet Wafers shall be the prices set forth in Exhibit D-1. 2. An updated Exhibit D-1, as outlined in Schedule 2 of this Amendment, will be appended to the Agreement and deemed a part thereof by reference. Effective April 1, 2018, and continuing until Cerus, at its sole discretion, decides that the Protocol EPP-029-886 under which Porex is currently operating can no longer be maintained, the cost for Platelet Wafers will follow the prices specified in Exhibit D-1. Once Cerus decides that the Protocol EPP-029-886 can be terminated, Cerus shall deliver written notice to Porex and a new purchase order for Platelet Wafers (the "New Pricing PO"). Following the date of such notification, the "Pricing" table for Platelet Wafers in Exhibit D, as it existed prior to the effective date of this Amendment, will be reinstated and will apply to Platelet Wafers produced in accordance with the New Pricing PO and after the written notice has been delivered. References in Section 1.5.1 of the Agreement to "Exhibit D" shall now encompass "Exhibit D-1," as appropriate.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility for the price change back to Cerus by stating that they will reinstate the previous pricing table upon their own determination to terminate the Protocol EPP-029-886. Additionally, I used "can no longer be maintained" instead of "can be discontinued" to weaken the obligation slightly, implying that there may be factors preventing the Protocol from being completely ceased.

original: 1.5.3 Porex will invoice Cerus monthly for Services performed by Porex during the prior month. Payment information, including Tax Identification Number will be included on each invoice.
ollama_generated: 1.5.3 In contrast, Cerus will be responsible for remitting payment to Porex within [*] days following the receipt of the monthly invoice issued by Porex for the Services rendered during the preceding month. original: “3a Non-Production Related Work. From time to time, Cerus may submit to Porex written work orders substantially in the form of Schedule 3 that specify development activities, engineering analysis, part, material and/or fixture design and development, or other services or activities that Cerus requests Porex to perform that are not activities or services that are necessary for the then-current manufacture and production of Components for Cerus under the Agreement (collectively, as defined in each work order, the “ Services ”). Each work order shall set forth the terms and conditions (including specifications (if applicable), delivery and performance schedules, and fees) pursuant to which Porex will perform the Services. Upon acceptance of a work order by Porex (in writing), such work order shall become a “Statement of Work .” If Porex begins to perform services under a work order that has not been formally agreed in writing, then Porex shall bear the costs of any expenses incurred prior to formal written agreement of the Statement of Work. Cerus hereby consents to Porex’s use of the Cerus Dedicated Space and Equipment, as specified in a Statement of Work, solely as necessary to perform the Services under that Statement of Work. Such consent shall automatically terminate upon the completion of the applicable Statement of Work and is limited by the terms of the Agreement. In the event of any conflict between the Agreement and a Statement of Work, the Agreement shall control unless the Statement of Work expressly refers to the Parties’ intent to alter the terms of the Agreement with respect to that Statement of Work and shall not be construed as an amendment to the terms of the Agreement.” 6.A new section titled “Pricing for Non-Production Related Work Orders from Cerus” is added to Exhibit D as set forth in Schedule 2 attached. Such pricing, upon mutual agreement of the Parties, shall apply to any Statement of Work mutually agreed by the Parties pursuant to Section 3a.
ollama_generated:
3a. Non-Production Related Services Request: At Cerus' discretion, it may issue written service requests to Porex, as outlined in Schedule 3 (referred to herein as "Work Requests"), which detail activities such as development, engineering analysis, design, or other tasks that are not essential for the ongoing manufacturing and production of Components under this Agreement. The Work Requests will outline the terms and conditions (including specifications, delivery schedules, performance requirements, and fees) required for Porex's service delivery. Once Porex acknowledges a Work Request in writing, it becomes a "Project Scope." If Porex initiates services based on an unagreed Work Request, it assumes the costs associated with any expenses accrued prior to the formal written agreement of the Project Scope.

Cerus grants permission for Porex to use its designated space and equipment, as specified in the Project Scope, solely for the purpose of fulfilling the agreed services under that Project Scope. This permission will terminate upon completion of the corresponding Project Scope and is subject to the conditions outlined in this Agreement. In case of any inconsistency between this Agreement and a Project Scope, this Agreement takes precedence unless the Project Scope explicitly indicates the Parties' intent to modify the terms of this Agreement specifically for that Project Scope, which shall not be construed as an amendment to this Agreement.

A new section titled "Pricing for Cerus-Initiated Work Requests" is incorporated into Exhibit D (as defined in Schedule 2 attached). The pricing agreed upon by both Parties will apply to any Project Scope mutually accepted by the Parties under Section 3a.

Cerus Corporation Accepted:

Upon the occurrence of any Event of Default under this Agreement as defined herein, the Obligee shall not be required to provide notice to the Obliger, but may, at its sole discretion, elect to do so. The Obligor shall be solely responsible for identifying and remedying any such Event of Default within a reasonable period of time following receipt of any such notice from the Obligee, if given. Furthermore, failure by the Obligee to provide notice shall not absolve the Obligor of its obligations under this Agreement or limit any remedies available to the Obligee for breach thereof.

Date: [Porex Corporation] Signed:

In the spirit of fairness, mutual understanding, and respect for our ongoing business relationship, we hereby agree as follows:

In the event that either party fails to meet their contractual obligations in a timely manner, the non-defaulting party shall exercise its discretion and provide written notice to the defaulting party, outlining the specific breach of contract. The defaulting party shall then have a grace period of [XX] business days to rectify the situation before any further action is taken by the non-defaulting party. In the unlikely event that the defaulting party does not remedy the issue within the specified time frame, the non-defaulting party reserves the right to terminate this agreement and seek appropriate remedies in accordance with applicable law.

This clause has been inverted slightly to provide the defaulting party with a grace period before any action is taken by the non-defaulting party, while still maintaining the professional tone and adherence to standard contract practices.
